H0.text: Forming fruit is a function of a seed.

H1.text: Making pollen is a function of a seed.

H2.text: Storing food for a new plant is a function of a seed.

H3.text: Taking in water from the ground is a function of a seed.

A4.text: In the flowering plants, the ovary ripens into a fruit which contains the seed and serves to disseminate it.

A5.text: Within the seed, there usually is a store of nutrients for the seedling that will grow from the embryo.
